UFO sightings plummet across UK as we're all too 'distracted' looking on our phones
Source: Daily Star    Published: 2025-07-19 15:19:00

UFO sightings have plummeted across Britain - because people are too glued to their mobile phones. Having previously been bombarded with hundreds of 999 calls over flying saucers, a police probe suggests UFO reports have dried up in the past year. Some forces - like Cheshire and Gwent - revealed they had no record of any close encounters so far in 2025. It is a far cry from the galactic goggling in the 80s and 90s, when the likes of The X Files had Brits scouring the stars for little green men. However, Britain's leading UFO investigator thinks we are still being visited by extraterrestrials - just that we've stopped noticing. Russ Kellett, from Yorkshire, who has been abducted dozens of times, said: ‚ÄúThere are plenty of aliens and UFOs out there, but people are too distracted to notice. ‚ÄúPeople are too busy looking down to see what is above us. There have always been highs and lows with UFO reports - I'm currently looking at a strange report of a flying saucer landing in Scarborough a few years back - so the truth is out there. ‚ÄúBut the only way we will ever find it is by watching the skies - not social media.‚Äù The Daily Star Sunday's exclusive findings follow Freedom of Information requests to forces across the UK, which previously unearthed hundreds of reports - ranging from mysterious flashing lights to one person in Belfast beamed aboard a UFO while taking a ciggie break. Yet reports have dried up; Even in Wiltshire - the UK's crop circle capital - cops confirmed they had no record of any spooky sightings so far this year. However, some forces did disclose details, including one caller in Northampton who had been beamed aboard a UFO - then kidnapped by bigfoot. Supernatural's Impressive Streaming Milestone Confirms How Badly We Need A Revival
Source: Screen Rant    Published: 2025-07-19 14:40:00

Even five years after its conclusion, Supernatural remains incredibly popular on streaming, proving that we need a revival now more than ever. Following monster-hunting brothers Sam (Jared Padalecki) and Dean (Jensen Ackles) Winchester, Supernatural ran for an impressive fifteen seasons on the CW, delivering 327 episodes. Supernatural finally came to an end in 2020, with a finale that was divisive among fans. Still, the short-lived semi-prequel series, The Winchesters, proved that there were more stories to tell in the Supernatural universe. While The Winchesters may have chosen to focus on the wrong characters, a Supernatural revival with Sam and Dean would undoubtedly be a success, as evidenced by the show's continued popularity on streaming. Nielsen recently released their list of the top twenty streaming programs for the first half of 2025, and Supernatural made an appearance as number fifteen on the list. Most of the other shows with streaming success had either recently aired new episodes or are still ongoing series, making Supernatural's ranking even more impressive. While Supernatural developed a passionate fan base throughout its fifteen-season run on the CW, it continues to find new fans on streaming services like Netflix. The show may have ended five years ago, but its fanbase has only continued to grow. Ackles and Padalecki have both found success in other projects, but for many, they will always be Dean and Sam Winchester. Soon after Supernatural came to an end, fans began speculating about whether the series was truly over for good. Padalecki, Ackles, and Misha Collins all seem open to return for a potential revival, and Supernatural's continued popularity proves that fans would undoubtedly tune in. Jared Padalecki, Jensen Ackles, and Misha Collins are set to reunite on screen in the upcoming final season of Prime Videos The Boys. Although Dean Winchester was tragically killed in Supernatural's finale, he has returned from the dead numerous times before. The Winchesters even checked in with Dean after his death, as he continued saving the multiverse from Heaven. The death of one of the main characters may have stopped other shows from returning for a revival, but not Supernatural. Supernatural fans have long hoped to see the show renewed for season 16, but there's one significant obstacle currently preventing a revival. With Supernatural's extensive mythology and unique combination of genres, the possibilities for a revival are truly endless. Fan interest in the series has clearly not waned, and the Supernatural multiverse has plenty of stories that have yet to be fully explored. Supernatural's continued success proves that you can't keep the Winchesters down for long, and it seems almost inevitable that Sam and Dean Winchester will return to our screens at some point, hopefully in the not-too-distant future. Source: Nielsen Your comment has not been saved Supernatural is a television series that follows brothers Sam and Dean Winchester, who were raised by their father to hunt and combat supernatural entities after losing their mother to a demonic force. Traversing the American landscape in their '67 Chevy Impala, they face numerous paranormal threats. We want to hear from you! Share your opinions in the thread below and remember to keep it respectful. Your comment has not been saved This thread is open for discussion. Be the first to post your thoughts. Mastering such a wide and varied genre like sci-fi isn't easy, and keeping that quality up is even harder - which makes masterpieces stand even more. Marvel may be teasing the next Silver Surfer with hints at Norrin Radd's death and one of his enemies' connection to a version of the Power Cosmic. The 2025 legacy sequel I Know What You Did Last Summer breaks an unfortunate box office record that has been held for nearly three decades. Glenn Close may be known for her inimitable presence as a feature film heavyweight, but one of her best roles was on the small screen. Netflix's cult classic horror comedy Santa Clarita Diet was just starting to get good when the streamer canceled it in its third season. After its season premiere was recently delayed, South Park's streaming future takes a major step forward, thanks to an exciting new settlement update. As Logan hands the Wolverine codename to his official successor, Marvel has a new ultimate healing factor - one that's as much of a curse as a gift.

Animator Shares Harrowing Details About Paranormal Attack With LA Marzulli
Source: Charisma Magazine Online    Published: 2025-07-19 11:02:03

Charisma Magazine Online The Magazine About Spirit-led Living Charisma Magazine Online The Magazine About Spirit-led Living Share via: In a gripping account that blurs the line between the natural and the supernatural, animation director Larry Whitaker‚Äîwhose credits include ‚ÄúTiny Tunes‚Äù and ‚ÄúSpace Jam‚Äù‚Äîrecalled a chilling experience that left him shaken and transformed. Speaking with L.A. Marzulli, Whitaker described a spiritual encounter while staying in Thiruvananthapuram, India. What began as an ordinary business trip quickly turned into a vivid confrontation with evil beyond the physical realm. Whitaker awoke in the middle of the night to find the lights in his room dimming unnaturally. What followed was a sight he says defies scientific explanation: a dense black mass, thicker than any natural shadow, began sweeping through the room. It moved with intelligence and purpose, not like fog or smoke, but as something alive. He described it as ‚Äúblacker than black,‚Äù a volumetric darkness that carried an unmistakable malevolent presence. Breaking News. Spirit-Filled Stories. Subscribe to Charisma on YouTube now! As the entity advanced, tendrils of it reached out toward him‚Äîone touching his tongue. The sensation, Whitaker said, was like a powerful electric shock that left him paralyzed. In that terrifying moment, unable to move or speak clearly, something inside him rose up. He managed to say, ‚ÄúThe Lord is holy.‚Äù At that declaration, the darkness reacted violently. It instantly flattened out and exited the room in a flash, as if repelled by the holiness of God's name. Still shaken the next day, Whitaker shared the event with Christian friends, who believed it may have been a form of spiritual retaliation. Earlier during his trip, he had boldly refused to participate in a local Shiva festival and had instead told a young Indian boy, ‚ÄúRemember Jesus.‚Äù It was a seemingly innocent comment, but one that could have stirred spiritual opposition in a region steeped in strong religious traditions. Get your FREE CHARISMA NEWSLETTERS today! Stay up-to-date with current issues, Holy Spirit news, Christian teachings, Charisma videos & more! The spiritual tension didn't end there. The following day, while washing his hands at a seaside restaurant, Whitaker heard an unnatural growling sound emanating from a dead palm tree behind him. With no one else around and no animals in sight, he spoke against it, and the noise stopped. In another moment of supernatural intervention, Whitaker shared how he once heard a voice while driving tell him to slow down. Seconds later, a herd of deer darted across the road‚Äîan accident narrowly avoided. These experiences, he believes, underscore the reality of spiritual warfare and divine protection for believers. Join Charisma Magazine Online to follow everything the Holy Spirit is doing around the world! Whitaker's experience serves as a sobering reminder of the unseen battle that rages around us and the authority believers have through our faith in Christ. As Whitaker put it, ‚ÄúI didn't fight it. I just declared who God was‚Äîand that was enough.‚Äù Abby Trivett is content development editor for Charisma Media.
